intro: Corunastylis tasmanica, commonly known as the Tasmanian star sedge, is a species of flowering plant native to Tasmania. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in wet or damp habitats such as swamps and heathlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes. The botanical features of Corunastylis tasmanica make it an important component of Tasmania's native flora.
